alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 21 at 10:52PM MDT until March 23 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional accumulations of 2 to 4 feet at higher elevations and 1 to 2 feet lower elevations. Strong winds gusting up to 75 mph at mountain top level. Intense winds will have the potential to blow down trees with the most intense winds occur early Wednesday morning into Wednesday evening. Thundersnow may be possible on Wednesday. * WHERE...Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Feet and the Upper Rio Grande Valley and the Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Feet. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be extremely difficult if not impossible. White-out conditions are near certain, especially tonight through Wednesday evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft
